channel.title: Newb Question -- PLEASE ANSWER
channel.description:
Okay, so here's my dilemma: I'm trying to make a lottery, but my initial thought is: How do I do this? 'int lotteryTime = 500;' will just make a private variable for that one character.
So my question is, how do I make it so that a variable works across the server, for all people?
Like, if one variable is 458, then it is 458 for every other person on the server.
Thanks in advance, Zach
PS: I'm starting to notice people seem to only comment on the easiest freaking help threads ever made. o.O[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 05:34:48 PM[/size][hr]Wonder if bumps work o.o

item.title: Newb Question -- PLEASE ANSWER
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

Okay, so here’s my dilemma:
I’m trying to make a lottery, but my initial thought is: How do I do this? ‘int lotteryTime = 500;’ will just make a private variable for that one character.

So my question is, how do I make it so that a variable works across the server, for all people?

Like, if one variable is 458, then it is 458 for every other person on the server.

Thanks in advance,
Zach

PS: I’m starting to notice people seem to only comment on the easiest freaking help threads ever made. o.O[br][br][size=1]Posted on: March 25, 2008, 05:34:48 PM[/size][hr]Wonder if bumps work o.o

Read full topic
